item.title: Report X-2025030384
item.description:
Report X-2025030384

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-07
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The tank car observed leaking by UPRR yard personnel. Haz Mat Manager Tom Robinson jr. was called for a response. Manager Robinson dispatched E3 environmental contractor and they found the car had leaked from the manway that did not have a manway gasket between the nozzle and the man way lid. The contractor placed the proper gasket and sealed the man way lid properly. The car is still in Houston awaiting an OTMA from the shipper to continue in transportation.

item.title: Report E-2025030140
item.description:
Report E-2025030140

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-07
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 7, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1294 was punctured and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the site. The crews utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the trailer. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged pail was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025030085
item.description:
Report E-2025030085

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-05
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FUEL SOUTH EXPRESS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 3 to 4-gallons of diesel fuel released due to either the hose or an overfill. The release impacted the concrete only. No soil, drains, or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS dispatched E3 Environmental to assist with cleanup. E3 Environmental deployed microblaze and granular absorbents to the impacted area. The spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one, 55-gallon drum and transported off-site for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025030382
item.description:
Report X-2025030382

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-03
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2050
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GATX 28473 was found in the Dayton, TX yard leaking from the manway when the car was moved on 3/3/2025. A BNSF Contractor was dispatched, investigated GATX 28473 and determined the release was due to a bad manway gasket and 3 of 6 manway bolts less than tool tight. The gasket was replaced and the car was properly secured. The release was contained to the car and did not impact the ground.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 28, 2025, four (4) 7-gallon pails of resin solution had faulty packaging and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental (E3) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged pails in two (2) 55-gallon drums. E3 utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove any sign of product. All impacted material was containerized in one (1) 5-gallon pail.

item.title: Report E-2025030162
item.description:
Report E-2025030162

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-26
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 09:56 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal LDA. It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of Rocryl 410 released from one 55-gallon metal drum due to the lid being improperly secured. The release impacted trailer #3214168. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Waste label 228771-1 was created, one 95-gallon poly drum containing Oil Dri and one 55-gallon metal drum containing leftover product. CHEMTREC was notified of the release, report #2025022600087 was given by Charlie. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2025030262
item.description:
Report X-2025030262

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-25
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING NORMAL UNLOADING PROCESS ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING A DARK LIQUID. AN EMPLOYEE WAS EXPOSED TO THE UNKNOWN DARK LIQUID CAUSING A NEGATIVE REACTION. THE SUBSTANCE BEGAN EATING AWAY THE SHIRT AND A BURNING SENSATION WAS FELT ON THEIR ABDOMEN AREA. ONSITE IMMEDIATE ACTION WAS TAKEN TO REMOVE THEIR SHIRT AND WASH THE AFFECTED AREA. EMPLOYEE WAS THEN TREATED AT A LOCAL CLINIC AND RELEASED. RESPONDER INSPECTED PACKAGE CONTENTS TO FIND FOUR X ONE LITER JUGS OF CORROSIVE HERCULES CLOBBER EMERGENCY DRAIN OPENER. ONE OF THE CONTAINERS WAS LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A REGULATED DANGEROUS GOODS WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM TEXAS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER K1012B, CORPUS WAREHOUSE, 2050 SARATOGA BLVD, CORPUS CHRISTI TX 78417-3403.THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2025030088
item.description:
Report E-2025030088

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-20
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ES&H was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the dock floor and estimated thirty (30) to forty (40) gallons of material was released due to a pallet on a forklift striking the tote and damaging the valve. The spill area measured approximately 10’ wide by 10’ long. ES&H transferred the remaining product into a new, undamaged tote. The old tote was cut up and containerized into (2) 55-gallon DMs along with some impacted granular absorbents. There was a third drum, 85-gallon DM, that was started by the terminal personnel and contained impacted absorbents. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal

A fire did NOT ignite the area was clear of any personnel at the time of the incident. Dangerous Goods Information: UN1046, HELIUM, COMPRESSED, CLASS 2.2, 3 STEEL CYLINDERS x 10 KG, OVERPACK USED, TOTAL QUANTITY 30 KG Pl200 FLIGHT INFORMATION: Inbound FLT: 47-FRA / Arrived 17JAN2025 / ATA: 1807 CHEMTREC Case number: 2025011800030 Safe harbor assessed situation FAA investigated- FAA provided permission to release shipment

item.title: Report I-2025020009
item.description:
Report I-2025020009

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: BROWNWOOD
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver arrived at 3m location in Brownwood and noticed leaking from the drums. Driver had picked up a big steel pipe earler driver had it strapped to the wall, during transit the strap broke and the steel pipe rolled into the drums, puncturing 3 drums the size of a pin hole. 3m associates would not let the driver unload or touch the freight until Hazmat one arrived to clean up the spill. Cardboard and kitty litter were put down to contain the material until Hazmat one arrived.
